00032 // Provide access to the DDS. This class is used to parse DDS text files, to
00033 // produce a printed representation of the in-memory variable table, and to
00034 // update the table on a per-variable basis.
00035 //
00036 // jhrg 9/8/94
00037 
00038 #ifndef _dds_h
00039 #define _dds_h 1
00040

00043 #pragma interface
00044 #endif
00045 #endif

00071 using std::cout;

00158 class DDS {
00159 private:
00160     // This struct is used to hold all the known `user defined' functions
00161     // (including those that are `built-in'). 
00162     struct function {
00163     string name;
00164     bool_func b_func;
00165     btp_func bt_func;
00166     proj_func p_func;
00167 
00168     function(const string &n, const bool_func f)
00169         : name(n), b_func(f), bt_func(0), p_func(0) {}
00170     function(const string &n, const btp_func f)
00171         : name(n), b_func(0), bt_func(f), p_func(0) {}
00172     function(const string &n, const proj_func f)
00173         : name(n), b_func(0), bt_func(0), p_func(f) {}
00174     function(): name(""), b_func(0), bt_func(0), p_func(0) {}
00175     };
00176 
00177     string name;        // The dataset name
00178 
00179     string _filename;       // File name (or other OS identifier) for
00180                 // dataset or part of dataset.
00181 
00182     vector<BaseType *> vars;    // Variables at the top level 
00183     
00184     vector<Clause *> expr;  // List of CE Clauses
00185 
00186     vector<BaseType *> constants;// List of temporary objects
00187 
00188     vector<function> functions; // Known external functions
00189 
00190     int d_timeout;      // alarm time in seconds. If greater than
00191                 // zero, raise the alarm signal if more than
00192                 // d_timeout seconds are spent reading data.
00193 
00194 protected:
00195     void duplicate(const DDS &dds);
00196     BaseType *leaf_match(const string &name, btp_stack *s = 0);
00197     BaseType *exact_match(const string &name, btp_stack *s = 0);
00198 
00199 public:
00200     typedef std::vector<BaseType *>::const_iterator Vars_citer ;
00201     typedef std::vector<BaseType *>::iterator Vars_iter ;
00202     typedef std::vector<Clause *>::const_iterator Clause_citer ;
00203     typedef std::vector<Clause *>::iterator Clause_iter ;
00204     typedef std::vector<BaseType *>::const_iterator Constants_citer ;
00205     typedef std::vector<BaseType *>::iterator Constants_iter ;
00206     typedef std::vector<function>::const_iterator Functions_citer ;
00207     typedef std::vector<function>::iterator Functions_iter ;
00208 
00209     DDS(const string &n = "");
00210 
00211     DDS(const DDS &dds);
00212 
00213     virtual ~DDS();
00214 
00215     DDS & operator=(const DDS &rhs); 
00216 
00217     string get_dataset_name();
00218 
00219     void set_dataset_name(const string &n);
00220 
00221     string filename();
00222     void filename(const string &fn);
00223 
00224     void add_var(BaseType *bt);
00225 
00226     void del_var(const string &n);
00227 
00228     BaseType *var(const string &n, btp_stack &s);
00229     BaseType *var(const string &n, btp_stack *s = 0);
00230     BaseType *var(const char *n, btp_stack *s = 0);
00231 
00232     BaseType *var(Pix p);
00233  
00234     Pix first_var();
00235     void next_var(Pix p);
00236     int num_var();
00237 
00239     Vars_iter var_begin();
00240 
00243     Vars_iter var_end();
00244 
00245     Vars_iter get_vars_iter(int i);
00246 
00247     void del_var(Vars_iter &i);
00248 
00249     void del_var(Vars_iter &i1, Vars_iter &i2);
00250 
00251     void timeout_on();
00252     void timeout_off();
00253     void set_timeout(int t);
00254     int get_timeout();
00255 
00256 #if 0
00257     template <class FUNC_T> void add_function(const string &name, FUNC_T f);
00258 #endif
00259 #if 1
00260     void add_function(const string &name, bool_func f);
00261     void add_function(const string &name, btp_func f);
00262     void add_function(const string &name, proj_func f);
00263 #endif
00264 
00265     bool find_function(const string &name, bool_func *f) const;
00266     bool find_function(const string &name, btp_func *f) const;
00267     bool find_function(const string &name, proj_func *f) const;
00268 
00269     Pix first_clause();
00270     void next_clause(Pix p);
00271     Clause *clause(Pix p);
00272     bool clause_value(Pix p, const string &dataset);
00273 
00274     void append_clause(int op, rvalue *arg1, rvalue_list *arg2);
00275     void append_clause(bool_func func, rvalue_list *args);
00276     void append_clause(btp_func func, rvalue_list *args);
00277 
00278     bool functional_expression();
00279     bool boolean_expression();
00280     bool eval_selection(const string &dataset);
00281     BaseType *eval_function(const string &dataset);
00283     Clause_iter clause_begin();
00284 
00287     Clause_iter clause_end();
00288 
00291     bool clause_value(Clause_iter &i, const string &dataset);
00292 
00293     void parse_constraint(const string &constraint);
00294 
00295     // Both of the following are deprecated methods.
00296     void parse_constraint(const string &constraint, ostream &os,
00297               bool server = true);
00298 
00299     void parse_constraint(const string &constraint, FILE *out,
00300               bool server = true);
00301 
00302     void append_constant(BaseType *btp);
00303 
00304     void parse(string fname);
00305     void parse(int fd);
00306     void parse(FILE *in=stdin);
00307 
00308     void print(ostream &os = cout);
00309     void print(FILE *out);
00310     void print_constrained(ostream &os = cout);
00311     void print_constrained(FILE *out);
00312 
00313     bool send(const string &dataset, const string &constraint, FILE *out, 
00314           bool compressed = true, const string &cgi_ver = "",
00315           time_t lmt = 0);
00316 
00317     void mark_all(bool state);
00318     bool mark(const string &name, bool state);
00319     bool check_semantics(bool all = false);
00320 };

00322 // Revision 1.4  2004/02/05 06:51:16  jimg
00322 // Added/update.
00322 //
00323 // Revision 1.50.2.2  2003/07/25 06:04:28  jimg
00324 // Refactored the code so that DDS:send() is now incorporated into
00325 // DODSFilter::send_data(). The old DDS::send() is still there but is
00326 // depracated.
00327 // Added 'smart timeouts' to all the variable classes. This means that
00328 // the new server timeouts are active only for the data read and CE
00329 // evaluation. This went inthe BaseType::serialize() methods because it
00330 // needed to time both the read() calls and the dds::eval() calls.
00331 //
00332 // Revision 1.50.2.1  2003/06/23 11:49:18  rmorris
00333 // The #pragma interface directive to GCC makes the dynamic typing functionality
00334 // go completely haywire under OS X on the PowerPC.  We can't use that directive
00335 // on that platform and it was ifdef'd out for that case.
00336 //

00343 // get_vars_iter(i).

00372 // Revision 1.41.4.8  2002/10/02 17:50:36  pwest
00373 // Added two new del_vars methods. The first takes an iterator and deltes the
00374 // variable referenced by that iterator. The iterator now points to the element
00375 // after the deleted element. The second method takes two iterators and will
00376 // delete the variables starting from the first iterator and up to, not
00377 // including the second iterator.
00378 //
00379 // Revision 1.41.4.7  2002/09/22 14:15:43  rmorris
00380 // Changed the use of vector to std::vector.  The 'using' directive for VC++
00381 // no longer cut it in this case.
00382 //
00383 // Revision 1.41.4.6  2002/09/12 22:49:57  pwest
00384 // Corrected signature changes made with Pix to IteratorAdapter changes. Rather
00385 // than taking a reference to a Pix, taking a Pix value.
00386 //
00387 // Revision 1.41.4.5  2002/09/05 22:52:54  pwest
00388 // Replaced the GNU data structures SLList and DLList with the STL container
00389 // class vector<>. To maintain use of Pix, changed the Pix.h header file to
00390 // redefine Pix to be an IteratorAdapter. Usage remains the same and all code
00391 // outside of the DAP should compile and link with no problems. Added methods
00392 // to the different classes where Pix is used to include methods to use STL
00393 // iterators. Replaced the use of Pix within the DAP to use iterators instead.
00394 // Updated comments for documentation, updated the test suites, and added some
00395 // unit tests. Updated the Makefile to remove GNU/SLList and GNU/DLList.
00396 //
00397 // Revision 1.46  2002/06/18 15:36:24  tom
00398 // Moved comments and edited to accommodate doxygen documentation-generator.
00399 //
00400 // Revision 1.45  2002/06/03 22:21:15  jimg
00401 // Merged with release-3-2-9
00402 //
00403 // Revision 1.41.4.4  2002/03/01 21:03:08  jimg
00404 // Significant changes to the var(...) methods. These now take a btp_stack
00405 // pointer and are used by DDS::mark(...). The exact_match methods have also
00406 // been updated so that leaf variables which contain dots in their names
00407 // will be found. Note that constructor variables with dots in their names
00408 // will break the lookup routines unless the ctor is the last field in the
00409 // constraint expression. These changes were made to fix bug 330.
00410 //
00411 // Revision 1.44  2001/09/28 17:50:07  jimg
00412 // Merged with 3.2.7.
00413 //
00414 // Revision 1.41.4.3  2001/09/25 20:33:26  jimg
00415 // Removed debug.h
00416 //
00417 // Revision 1.43  2001/08/24 17:46:22  jimg
00418 // Resolved conflicts from the merge of release 3.2.6
00419 //
00420 // Revision 1.41.4.2  2001/07/28 01:10:42  jimg
00421 // Some of the numeric type classes did not have copy ctors or operator=.
00422 // I added those where they were needed.
00423 // In every place where delete (or delete []) was called, I set the pointer
00424 // just deleted to zero. Thus if for some reason delete is called again
00425 // before new memory is allocated there won't be a mysterious crash. This is
00426 // just good form when using delete.
00427 // I added calls to www2id and id2www where appropriate. The DAP now handles
00428 // making sure that names are escaped and unescaped as needed. Connect is
00429 // set to handle CEs that contain names as they are in the dataset (see the
00430 // comments/Log there). Servers should not handle escaping or unescaping
00431 // characters on their own.
00432 //
00433 // Revision 1.42  2001/06/15 23:49:01  jimg

00435 //

00438 //
00439 // Revision 1.41  2000/09/22 02:17:19  jimg
00440 // Rearranged source files so that the CVS logs appear at the end rather than
00441 // the start. Also made the ifdef guard symbols use the same naming scheme and
00442 // wrapped headers included in other headers in those guard symbols (to cut
00443 // down on extraneous file processing - See Lakos).
00444 //
00445 // Revision 1.40  2000/09/21 16:22:07  jimg
00446 // Merged changes from Jose Garcia that add exceptions to the software.
00447 // Many methods that returned error codes now throw exectptions. There are
00448 // two classes which are thrown by the software, Error and InternalErr.
00449 // InternalErr is used to report errors within the library or errors using
00450 // the library. Error is used to reprot all other errors. Since InternalErr
00451 // is a subclass of Error, programs need only to catch Error.
00452 //

00459 // included this header without also including config_dap.h.

00463 // returned a DataDDS * but the object was assigned to a DDS * and later
00464 // deleted. Since DDS:~DDS() was not virtual, the DataDDS dtor was not being
00465 // run.

00555 // Revision 1.18  1996/12/03 00:14:58  jimg
00556 // Added ostream and bool params to parse_constraint(). The bool parameter is
00557 // used to tell the member function that it is running in the server of the
00558 // client. The ostream is the sink for error objects (server side) or messages
00559 // (client side).
00560 //
00561 // Revision 1.17  1996/12/02 23:14:54  jimg
00562 // Added `filename' field and access functions. This field is for recording
00563 // the filename associated with the dataset from which the DDS is generated.
00564 // It does not actually have to be a filename; rather it is intended to be
00565 // used by BaseType's read() member function when that code must access some
00566 // OS controlled resource to get data for a particular variable. For most
00567 // systems it will be a file, while for some systems it may be a RDB or
00568 // blank.
00569 //
00570 // Revision 1.16  1996/06/04 21:33:20  jimg
00571 // Multiple connections are now possible. It is now possible to open several
00572 // URLs at the same time and read from them in a round-robin fashion. To do
00573 // this I added data source and sink parameters to the serialize and
00574 // deserialize mfuncs. Connect was also modified so that it manages the data
00575 // source `object' (which is just an XDR pointer).
00576 //
00577 // Revision 1.15  1996/05/31 23:29:38  jimg
00578 // Updated copyright notice.
00579 //
00580 // Revision 1.14  1996/05/29 22:08:37  jimg
00581 // Made changes necessary to support CEs that return the value of a function
00582 // instead of the value of a variable. This was done so that it would be
00583 // possible to translate Sequences into Arrays without first reading the
00584 // entire sequence over the network.
00585 //

00594 // Merged changes from version 1.1.1.
00595 //
00596 // Revision 1.10  1996/03/05 18:32:26  jimg
00597 // Added the clause and function subclasses. Clause is used to hold a single
00598 // clause of the current CE. Clause has ctors, a dtor (which is currently
00599 // broken) and member function used to get the boolean value of the clause.
00600 // Function is used to hold a single pointer to either a function returning a
00601 // boolean or a BaseType *. The DDS class contains a list of clauses and a list
00602 // of functions.
00603 //
00604 // Revision 1.9  1996/02/01 17:43:10  jimg
00605 // Added support for lists as operands in constraint expressions.
00606 //
00607 // Revision 1.8  1995/12/09  01:06:39  jimg
00608 // Added changes so that relational operators will work properly for all the
00609 // datatypes (including Sequences). The relational ops are evaluated in
00610 // DDS::eval_constraint() after being parsed by DDS::parse_constraint().
00611 //
00612 // Revision 1.7  1995/12/06  21:05:08  jimg
00613 // Added print_constrained(): prints only those parts of the DDS that satisfy
00614 // the constraint expression (projection + array selection).
00615 // Added eval_constraint(): given the text of a constraint expression, evaluate
00616 // it in the environment of the current DDS.
00617 // Added mark*(): add the named variables to the current projection.
00618 // Added send(): combines many functions like reading and serializing variables
00619 // with constraint evaluation.
00620 //
